name: Signature Burnt Parotta
description: Delight in the Flaky Marvel of Homemade Parottas! Experience the Magic of Homemade Parottas: Flaky, Crispy, and Oh-So-Tasty!
ingredients: ¼ cup Milk at room temperature
instructions: In a large plate or mixing bowl, add 2 cups maida, 1 teaspoon sugar, salt as needed. Roughly mix it together and make a well in the center.
Pour ¼ cup milk (at room temperature) and add water as needed.
Knead into a soft pliable dough. Add 1 tablespoon oil on top.
Repeat special kneading technique until dough is soft and smooth.
Add 2 tablespoons oil on top, cover with a damp kitchen towel, and rest for at least 2 hours.

comments: A little tricky to make, but worth it.

name: Indonesian Chicken Noodles
description: A quick and easy chicken noodle recipe with a touch of Indonesia!
instructions: Boil the noodles as per the package instructions and set aside.
Heat sesame oil in a pan and sauté the chicken until fully cooked.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, and cooked noodles to the pan.
Stir well until all ingredients are mixed and heated through.

name: Chocolate Raspberry Mousse
description: A rich and creamy chocolate mousse with a hint of raspberry.
instructions: Melt dark chocolate in a double boiler or microwave.
Whip the heavy cream until soft peaks form.
Fold the melted chocolate and raspberry jam into the whipped cream.
Chill for 10 minutes and serve.

name: Oven Baked Tofu Shakshuka
description: A healthy twist on the classic shakshuka, with tofu!
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Sauté onion and bell peppers until softened.
Add tomatoes and paprika, simmer for 10 minutes.
Pour the mixture into an oven-safe dish, add tofu slices on top, and bake for 20 minutes.

name: Bubble Tea
description: A fun and refreshing drink that's easy to make at home.
instructions: Cook the tapioca pearls as per the package instructions.
Brew the tea bag in hot water for 5 minutes.
Combine tea, milk, and sugar. Add tapioca pearls and serve.

name: Thai Red Curry
description: A creamy and spicy Thai curry that's full of flavor.
instructions: Heat curry paste in a pan until fragrant.
Add coconut milk and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add chicken or tofu, and cook for 10 minutes.
Add vegetables and fish sauce, cook for another 10 minutes, and serve.

comments: Perfect balance of spice and creaminess.
